bioghist.p: Francis Hopkinson (1737-1791) was a jurist, author, musician, and signer of the Declaration of Independence. Oliver Hopkinson (1812-1905) served during the Civil War with the 1st Regiment, Delaware Volunteers and with the 51st Regiment Infantry, Pennsylvania Militia.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence and other items related to members of the Hopkinson family. Materials include: letters from Dale and Hopkinson family members, including Richard C. Dale (including two from General James Wilkinson, one dated 1810 and the other undated), A. H. Hopkinson, Oliver Hopkinson, Edward Hopkinson (all to family members), and Anne Dale Gibbs to her sister Margaret Dale; a letter from C. A. Rodney to Thomas Fitzgerald, 1804; a John P. Hopkinson passport issued by the French Government, 1828; a signed bank note from Francis Hopkinson, 1779, and receipt signed by Robert Morris, 1784; and currency, including postage and fractional currency, 1860s-1870s.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
